blogContent: I began walking, therefore, in a big curve, seeking some point of vantage and continually looking at the sand.

blogTitle: Then going through some small strange motions
blogContent: A moderate incline runs towards the foot of Maybury Hill, and down this we clattered. Once the lightning had begun, it went on in as rapid a succession of flashes as I have ever seen.
Through two long weeks I wandered, stumbling through the nights guided only by the stars and hiding during the days behind some protruding rock or among the occasional hills I traversed.

blogTitle: I shouted above the sudden noise.
blogContent: I shouted above the sudden noise. She looked away from me downhill. The people were coming out of their houses, astonished.

blogTitle: At daybreak of the fifteenth day of my search
blogContent: When the amphitheater had cleared I crept stealthily to the top and as the great excavation lay far from the plaza.

blogTitle: The great excavation lay far from the plaza
blogContent: Far from the plaza and in an untenanted portion of the great dead city I had little trouble in reaching the hills beyond
